title: 107_s2811
content: Emergency Forest Rescue Act of 2002 - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior to: (1) designate Federal forest land that is at wildfire risk because of severe drought and dead and dying trees as an emergency mitigation area. And (2) request authority from the Council on Environmental Quality to use alternative arrangements to protect trees in such an area from disease, insect infestation, invasive plant species, or other natural disaster.
